content.description:
Levophobia is a vertical problem that climbs an interesting set of features on solid rock with a not-so-good landing.

Stand start with a right hand three finger pinch and a left hand sidepull on the arete.  From there, bump the left up to a thumb catch on the arete, gain a right sidepull, reach a left sloper (crux), move to the pinch/gaston, then follow the diagonal feature until the lip, and top it out on the jugs.

The rock to the left is off.
content.protection: A few pads work, but three is ideal.  The immediate landing is good, but there is a large rock to the left that is ever present and a tree lies directly behind the problem.
content.location: This ascends the East face of Phobic Rock.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand bump on the arete and a right hand crimp. From there, reach a right hand edge, follow to a sharp feature on the arete, gain a right hand gaston, then the lip, and mantel on top the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing has a rock behind it, but it pads well.
content.location: It climbs the west side of the boulder's northwest arete.

content.description: Stand start with a left hand sidepull, and a right hand two-finger pocket.  From there, work up through some interesting sidepulls until reaching the chickenheads.  At this point, I went out right, as some of the chickenheads near the center top of the boulder didn't look solid.
content.protection: A pad or two, the landing is very good though.
content.location: This is on the east face of Phobic Rock.
